alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Douglas; Franklin (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 12:24AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Franklin, Anderson and Douglas Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1223 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southwest of Lawrence to 3 miles west of Rantoul to near Kincaid. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Lawrence, Ottawa, Baldwin City, Garnett, Eudora, Wellsville, Centropolis, Clinton, Richmond, Colony, Lone Star, Greeley, Princeton, Lane, Rantoul, Kincaid, Pleasant Grove, Lone Elm, Vinland and Clinton Lake. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 174 and 198. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for east central Kansas.
